resources.string:
The goal of team Putting Wi-Fi On the Map is to
provide students on the TCNJ campus with a fully
featured cell telephone application that provides
information regarding the school’s Wi-Fi signal
availability. Users report Wi-Fi status to collect
and record data pertaining to the location and
strength of Wi-Fi signals across campus. Data collected from user devices will be uploaded to a
database and software will calibrate different 
devices’ data to provide a common data format.
The data will be processed to produce a “heat
map” representing the Wi-Fi signal quality on the TCNJ campus. A legend will be provided that
expresses the relationship between the heat map
colors and the received signal power at the
device’s front-end amplifier.

This mobile application was created by:
Alexander Cook
Abdoulaye Diallo
Kari Gilbertson
Nicholas Vitone
